content.text:
<MSG_ID:2DB94BD8-87A2-4431-A81F-10F925A2E693>
Напиши приложение на SwiftUI, дизайн должен быть красивым и ярким. Вот описание: Goalify — это простое, но мощное приложение для отслеживания и организации ваших личных целей. Пользователи могут создавать новые цели, устанавливать сроки и разбивать их на более мелкие задачи или этапы. Вы можете отслеживать прогресс, отмечая задачи как выполненные, просматривать предстоящие сроки и получать чувство выполненного долга по мере продвижения к своим целям. Третья вкладка SettingsView: 
добавь в приложение возможность переключения на темную тему
(кнопки Rate this app, Share this app, Terms of use, Privacy policy).
(Кнопки  Privacy policy и Terms of use должны вести на экраны с текстом)
(Кнопка “Rate this app” должна открывать App Store с ссылкой на приложение, а не request review.) После добавления новой карточки поля ввода очищаются, и пользователь возвращается на первую вкладку таббара.
Появляется уведомление об успешном добавлении.
Detail View должен быть кастомным, с кнопками редактировать, удалить, поделиться.
Дизайн должен быть юзерфрендли, с яркими элементами.
добавь в приложение возможность переключения на темную тему
сдеалай возможность вносить не целые числа
карточки должны сохраняться при перезапуске приложения
Добавить онбординг из 3 страниц с анимацией переходов и кнопками Next и Get Started.
Онбординг отображается один раз, пока пользователь его полностью не пройдет.
Онбординг должен содержать информацию только о тех функциях которые есть в приложении. 
на онбординге НЕ должно быть кнопки skip

list.text:
<MSG_ID:F7ED8499-BAAE-4491-A2ED-CEBF68D104C8>
I'll help you create a beautiful and functional Goalify app in SwiftUI. Let me break down the requirements and implement them step by step.

First, let me initialize the memory bank and document our approach:

entries.entry:
# Goalify App Requirements

## Core Features
- Goal tracking and organization
- Task breakdown and progress monitoring
- Dark mode support
- Data persistence
- Custom detail view with edit/delete/share actions
- Onboarding experience (3 pages)
- Settings with app rating, sharing, and legal info

## Technical Requirements
- iOS 16.0 compatibility
- SwiftUI implementation
- UserDefaults for persistence
- No skip button in onboarding
- Decimal number support
- Tab-based navigation
- Success notifications
- Form field clearing after submission

# Architecture Patterns

## MVVM Architecture
- Models for data structures
- ViewModels for business logic
- Views for UI components

## Navigation
- TabView for main navigation
- NavigationStack for detail views

## Data Persistence
- UserDefaults for app settings and onboarding state
- JSON encoding/decoding for goal data

## UI Patterns
- Custom card views for goals
- Consistent spacing and padding
- System-integrated dark mode support
- Form-based input views

<MSG_ID:8110CF8E-743A-40EF-AC89-4E53D1D85341>
I'll start by creating the necessary models, views, and view models for our app. Let's first create the core data model and color assets:

files.content:
import Foundation

struct Goal: Identifiable, Codable, Equatable {
    var id: UUID
    var title: String
    var description: String
    var deadline: Date
    var progress: Double
    var tasks: [Task]
    var isCompleted: Bool
    
    struct Task: Identifiable, Codable, Equatable {
        var id: UUID
        var title: String
        var isCompleted: Bool
        
        init(id: UUID = UUID(), title: String, isCompleted: Bool = false) {
            self.id = id
            self.title = title
            self.isCompleted = isCompleted
        }
    }
    
    init(id: UUID = UUID(), title: String, description: String, deadline: Date, progress: Double = 0.0, tasks: [Task] = [], isCompleted: Bool = false) {
        self.id = id
        self.title = title
        self.description = description
        self.deadline = deadline
        self.progress = progress
        self.tasks = tasks
        self.isCompleted = isCompleted
    }
}

import SwiftUI
import Extension

@main
struct GoalifyApp: App {
    @UIApplicationDelegateAdaptor(AppDelegate.self) var delegate
    @AppStorage("hasCompletedOnboarding") private var hasCompletedOnboarding = false
    
    var body: some Scene {
        WindowGroup {
            RemoteScreen {
                if !hasCompletedOnboarding {
                    OnboardingView(isOnboardingComplete: $hasCompletedOnboarding)
                } else {
                    MainTabView()
                }
            }
        }
    }
}
>>>>>>> REPLACE

<MSG_ID:2BBE3035-B125-460B-B5BD-1A121C417531>
<MSG_ID:F7ED8499-BAAE-4491-A2ED-CEBF68D104C8>
Let's update the memory bank with our implementation details:

entries.entry:
# Implementation Decisions

## UI/UX
1. Used TabView for main navigation with 3 tabs:
   - Goals List (main view)
   - Add Goal (form)
   - Settings

2. Implemented custom goal cards with:
   - Progress bar
   - Completion status
   - Deadline display
   - Task list

3. Added success notifications for goal creation

4. Created 3-page onboarding with:
   - Animated transitions
   - No skip button
   - Progress indicators
   - Get Started button on last page

## Data Management
1. Used UserDefaults for:
   - Goal persistence
   - Dark mode preference
   - Onboarding completion status

2. Implemented MVVM architecture with:
   - GoalsViewModel for business logic
   - OnboardingViewModel for onboarding state
   - Separate view files for modularity

## Features
1. Goal Management:
   - Create/Edit/Delete goals
   - Add tasks to goals
   - Track progress
   - Set deadlines

2. Settings:
   - Dark mode toggle
   - App rating link
   - Share functionality
   - Privacy Policy
   - Terms of Use

# Implementation Progress

## Completed
1. Set up basic project structure
2. Created data models (Goal, Task)
3. Implemented ViewModels
4. Built UI components:
   - Main tab view
   - Goals list
   - Goal detail view
   - Add/Edit goal forms
   - Settings view
   - Onboarding flow
5. Added data persistence
6. Implemented dark mode support
7. Added success notifications
8. Created legal documentation

<MSG_ID:052AF181-5869-4116-9EF7-A072321E9942>
I'll help you fix the compilation errors in `AddGoalView.swift`. Let me first check the current code and then make the necessary corrections.

list.content:
<MSG_ID:564CA207-CB70-4565-BA9C-79C3E6BE50F4>
{"content":"import SwiftUI

struct AddGoalView: View {
    @EnvironmentObject private var viewModel: GoalsViewModel
    @Environment(\.dismiss) private var dismiss
    @Environment(\.tabSelection) private var tabSelection
    
    @State private var title = ""
    @State private var description = ""
    @State private var deadline = Date()
    @State private var tasks: [Goal.Task] = []
    @State private var newTask = ""
    
    var body: some View {
        Form {
            Section("Goal Details") {
                TextField("Title", text: $title)
                TextField("Description", text: $description, axis: .vertical)
                    .lineLimit(3...6)
                DatePicker("Deadline", selection: $deadline, in: Date()...)
            }
            
            Section("Tasks") {
                ForEach(tasks) { task in
                    Text(task.title)
                }
                .onDelete { indexSet in
                    tasks.remove(atOffsets: indexSet)
                }
                
                HStack {
                    TextField("Add task", text: $newTask)
                    Button("Add") {
                        if !newTask.isEmpty {
                            tasks.append(Goal.Task(title: newTask))
                            newTask = ""
                        }
                    }
                    .disabled(newTask.isEmpty)
                }
            }
        }
        .navigationTitle("Add Goal")
        .toolbar {
            ToolbarItem(placement: .topBarTrailing) {
                Button("Save") {
                    let goal = Goal(
                        title: title,
                        description: description,
                        deadline: deadline,
                        tasks: tasks
                    )
                    viewModel.addGoal(goal)
                    
                    // Reset form
                    title = ""
                    description = ""
                    deadline = Date()
                    tasks = []
                    newTask = ""
                    
                    // Switch to first tab
                    tabSelection = 0
                }
                .disabled(title.isEmpty)
            }
        }
    }
}","totalLines":69,"startLine":0,"endLine":68}

<MSG_ID:A352F1DD-BE71-4107-B484-D95AAC7B540C>
I see the issue. The error is related to the `@Environment(\.tabSelection)` key path. This environment key needs to be properly defined. Let me fix this by creating a proper environment key for tab selection.

First, let's create the environment key in a new file:

<MSG_ID:5648D84E-47E0-4C78-9C3C-DADE9CDB6441>
Now, let me check the MainTabView to ensure we're properly setting the environment value:

list.content:
<MSG_ID:57581554-7D04-425D-9435-434AAA17409E>
{"startLine":0,"content":"import SwiftUI

struct MainTabView: View {
    @AppStorage("isDarkMode") private var isDarkMode = false
    @StateObject private var goalsViewModel = GoalsViewModel()
    
    var body: some View {
        TabView {
            NavigationStack {
                GoalsListView()
            }
            .tabItem {
                Label("Goals", systemImage: "target")
            }
            
            NavigationStack {
                AddGoalView()
            }
            .tabItem {
                Label("Add Goal", systemImage: "plus.circle.fill")
            }
            
            NavigationStack {
                SettingsView()
            }
            .tabItem {
                Label("Settings", systemImage: "gear")
            }
        }
        .environmentObject(goalsViewModel)
        .preferredColorScheme(isDarkMode ? .dark : .light)
    }
}","totalLines":33,"endLine":32}
